Subject: Details about the process of passing a ProcessorURI to a custom processor
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=343342970

Hello, I have a processor that needs to access some HTML documents
fetched by Heritrix. If my seed urls contain an URL corresponding to
such a document, I noticed a strange behavior:

shouldProcess() and innerProcess(), for my URL, seems to be called 3
times for the same URL (the seed). On the first two attempts, the
content associated to the ProcessorURI is empty. I guess what's
happening is that Heritrix tries to retrieve the URL, but has to make
the dns: request first and then fetch the example.com/robots.txt file
before it actually retrieves the first document (corresponding to the
seed).

What I dont understand however, is why innerProcess and shouldProcess
are called three times... It should call these only once when
everything is ready, or at least that's what seems logical. Reading
the (old) heritrix 1.15 documentation did not help me, can someone
shed some light on this or point me to some code fragments that would
help me understand what's happening?

Thanks

Jean-Noel

PS: and I know it must be a very common question, but when
documentation on heritrix 2 is expected?
